meanings.sent1: She always manages to outargue her opponents with logical reasoning.
meanings.sent2: He tried to outargue his friend, but ended up agreeing with him instead.
meanings.sent3: The siblings constantly outargue each other over who gets to choose the TV channel.
meanings.sent4: In the courtroom, the skilled lawyer was able to outargue the prosecutor with ease.
meanings.sent5: Despite his efforts, he could never outargue his teacher's well-prepared points.

meanings.sent1: The debater was able to outargue all his opponents in the competition.
meanings.sent2: It is challenging to outargue someone who has a deep understanding of the topic.
meanings.sent3: The students tried to outargue their teacher, but she always had a clever response.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outargue others made her a formidable opponent in debates.
meanings.sent5: He hoped to outargue his rival in the debate by presenting strong evidence.
